Tugas Bertambah, Moeldoko Akan Punya Wakil KSP
07 Nov 2019, 16:38 by Pradipta Rahadi


Tugas Bertambah, Moeldoko Akan Punya Wakil KSP

KBRN, Jakarta : Kepala Staff Kepresidenan Moeldoko menyampaikan, bahwa instansi yang dipimpinnya akan ditambah personilnya, yaitu seorang wakil KSP. Penambahan personil seorang wakil KSP ini menurut Moeldoko sudah berdasarkan pertimbangan beban kerja yang bertambah.
Kantor Staff Kepresidenan kini berubah, berbeda dengan era lima tahun lalu. Perbedaan yang akan paling menyorot perhatian yaitu akan adanya seorang wakil KSP, yang akan membantu Kepala Staff Kepresidenan, Moeldoko. Moeldoko menjelaskan, saat ini Peraturan Presiden yang baru mengenai Kantor Staff Presiden masih disusun. 
"Nanti ada wakil Kepala Staf," kata Moeldoko di Istana Kepresidenan, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019)
Moeldoko mengatakan, penambahan posisi wakil KSP ini karena pertimbangan beban kerja. Sebab, KSP diberi tugas tambahan sebagai "delivery unit" yang bertugas memastikan bahwa program prioritas yang telah dicanangkan Presiden Jokowi dijalankan dengan baik oleh tiap kementerian.
"Mungkin ada pertimbangan beban kerja. Nanti wakil staf lebih ke delivery unit, kastaf lebih ke policy-nya akan kita bagi seperti itu," kata Moeldoko.
Moeldoko memastikan bahwa wakil kepala yang dipilih berlatar belakang profesional, bukan kader parpol atau relawan.
"Recruitment yang menjadi pilar utamanya adalah profesional. Sumber-sumbernya bisa dari kalangan profesional, bisa dari kalangan partai politik, bisa dari kalangan relawaqn, ormas, dan NGO." Tambah Moeldoko.
Adapun untuk tenaga deputi masih akan tetap dipimpin oleh lima orang deputi. Kelima deputi tersebut akan dibantu oleh beberapa orang staff khusus deputi.  
Selain Peraturan Presiden mengenai Kantor Staff Presiden, Presiden Joko Widodo juga akan mengeluarkan Peraturan Presiden Nomor 66 Tahun 2019 mengenai Susunan Organisasi Tentara Nasional Indonesia, dimana Wakil Panglima TNI akan dihidupkan, setelah terakhir ada di era pemerintahan Presiden Abdurrahman Wahid.

Additional Tasks, Moeldoko Will Have KSP Representatives
Nov 7 2019, 16:38 by Pradipta Rahadi


Additional Tasks, Moeldoko Will Have KSP Representatives

KBRN, Jakarta: Presidential Chief of Staff Moeldoko said that the agency he led would be added by his personnel, namely a KSP representative. The addition of personnel from a KSP representative, according to Moeldoko, was based on consideration of increased workload.
The Presidential Staff Office is now changing, different from the era of five years ago. The difference that will highlight the most attention is that there will be a KSP representative, who will help the Presidential Chief of Staff, Moeldoko. Moeldoko explained that currently the new Presidential Regulation regarding the Presidential Staff Office is still being drafted.
"Later there will be Deputy Chief of Staff," said Moeldoko at the Presidential Palace, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019)
Moeldoko said that the addition of the KSP representative position was due to workload considerations. Because, KSP was given an additional task as a "delivery unit" whose task was to ensure that the priority programs that had been launched by President Jokowi were carried out properly by each ministry.
"Maybe there are workload considerations. Later the staff representative will be more on the delivery unit, the staff will be more focused on the policy," said Moeldoko.
Moeldoko ensured that the deputy head chosen had a professional background, not political party cadres or volunteers.
"Recruitment which is the main pillar is professional. The sources can be from professionals, can be from political parties, can be from religious circles, mass organizations, and NGOs." Add Moeldoko.
As for the deputies, they will still be led by five deputies. The five deputies will be assisted by several special deputy staff members.
In addition to the Presidential Regulation concerning the Presidential Staff Office, President Joko Widodo will also issue Presidential Regulation Number 66 Year 2019 regarding the Organizational Structure of the Indonesian National Army, where the Deputy Commander of the TNI will be revived, after the latter was in the era of President Abdurrahman Wahid's administration.
